params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the category that was created.

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a category is created.
description:
The `onCategoryCreated()` event handler runs when a category is created. The received `CategoryCreated` object contains information about the category that was created.

>**Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event that occurs when a category is created
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the category that was deleted.

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a category is deleted.
description:
The `onCategoryDeleted()` event handler runs when a category is deleted. The received `CategoryDeleted` object contains event metadata.

>**Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event that occurs when a category is deleted
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the category that was updated.

description:
The `onCategoryUpdated()` event handler runs when a category is updated. The received `CategoryUpdated` object contains information about the category that was updated.

>**Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the post that was created.

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a post is created.
description:
The `onPostCreated()` event handler runs when a post is created. The `PostCreated` object contains information about the post that was created.

>**Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event that occurs when a blog post is created
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the post that was deleted.

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a post is deleted.
description:
The `onPostDeleted()` event handler runs when a post is deleted. The received `PostDeleted` object contains event metadata.

>**Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event that occurs when a blog post is deleted
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the post that was liked.

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a post is liked.
description:
The `onPostLiked()` event handler runs when a post is liked. The received `PostLikedEvent` object contains data about the liked post including the `postId`, and the `memberId` or `anonymousVisitorId`.

>**Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event that occurs when a blog post is liked

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a post is unliked.
description:
The `onPostUnliked()` event handler runs when a post is unliked. The received `PostUnlikedEvent` object contains the `postId` of the unliked post.

>**Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event that occurs when a post is unliked

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the post that was updated.

docs.summary: An event that triggers when a post is updated.

The `onPostUpdated()` event handler runs when a post is updated. The received `PostUpdated` object contains information about the post that was updated.

>**Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

// Add the file if it doesn't exist.

Number of items to return.

members.doc: Number of items that couldn't be processed.

members.doc: Number of items that were successfully processed.

members.doc: Number of failures without details because detailed failure threshold was exceeded.

members.doc: Whether to return the full created category entities in the response.

members.name: displayPosition
members.doc: Category position in sequence. Categories with lower display position are displayed first.

members.doc: Category label. Displayed in the Category Menu.

members.name: language

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether cover media is custom. If `false` the cover image is set to the first media item that appears in the content.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

description:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.

members.name: preventAutoRedirect
members.doc: disable auto creation of 301 redirects on slug changes (enabled by default).

members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: children

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the tag is a custom tag.

members.name: props
members.doc: SEO tag attributes/properties (name, content, rel, href).

members.name: fieldMask
members.doc: Field mask of fields to update.

description: Adds appearence changes to text

members.name: colsMinWidth
members.doc: Each entry in this array represent the respective column minimum width in pixels

members.name: colsWidthRatio
members.doc: Each entry in this array represent the relative width of the column in relation to the other columns

members.name: rowsHeight
members.doc: Each entry in this array represent the respective row height in pixels

members.name: categoryIds
members.doc: IDs of categories this post belongs to.

members.name: changeOrigin
members.doc: Origin on how the current draft post state was created.

members.name: commentingEnabled
members.doc: Whether commenting on the post is enabled.

members.name: excerpt
members.doc:
Post excerpt.
Can be selected by site owner or extracted from the post's text.

members.name: featured
members.doc: Whether the post is marked as featured.

members.name: firstPublishedDate
members.doc: Date the post was first published.

members.name: hasUnpublishedChanges
members.doc: Indicates if draft post have changes that are not yet published to the public.

members.name: hashtags
members.doc: Hashtags extracted from the post's content.

members.name: heroImage
members.doc: Hero image, as displayed at the top of the blog page.

members.name: language
members.doc: Language the post is written in.

members.name: moderationDetails
members.doc: Details about post moderation. Relevant only to posts submitted by guest writers.

members.doc: Number of paragraphs to show in paid content preview for non-paying users.

members.name: relatedPostIds
members.doc: IDs of posts that are related to this post.

members.name: tagIds
members.doc: IDs of tags the post is tagged with.

members.name: translationId
members.doc: ID of the post's translations. Translations of a single post into multiple languages will all share the same `translationId`.

members.name: url
members.doc: Draft post preview URL (how URL will look like when post will be published).

members.doc: Language the post is written in.

members.name: oembed

Category filter.

Hashtag filter.

members.name: language
members.doc:
Language filter.
Pass language to only receive posts that are in that language.

members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers that the link is specifically the result of paid placement; e.g., sponsored placements, advertorials, paid links, and similar.

members.name: ugc
members.doc: The ugc attribute should be used to identify links which are created by users (e.g., author links in a comment form), which therefore aren’t necessarily trusted or endorsed by the page’s author.

description:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.

members.name: preventAutoRedirect
members.doc: disable auto creation of 301 redirects on slug changes (enabled by default).

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: description
members.doc: Description displayed on top of the spoiler cover

members.name: enabled
members.doc: indicates whether spoiler is enabled on this plugin

members.name: children
members.doc: Tag inner content e.g. `<title> inner content </title>`.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the tag is a custom tag.

members.name: props
members.doc: SEO tag attributes/properties (name, content, rel, href).

members.name: format
members.doc: Video format for example, mp4, hls.

members.name: totalFailures
members.doc: Number of items that couldn't be processed.

members.name: totalSuccesses
members.doc: Number of items that were successfully processed.

members.name: undetailedFailures
members.doc: Number of failures without details because detailed failure threshold was exceeded.

members.name: fields
members.doc: List of tag fields to be included in the response.

members.name: fieldsToInclude
members.doc: List of tag fields to be included in the response.

members.name: returnFullEntity
members.doc: Whether to return the full created tag entities in the response.

members.doc: List of tag fields to be included in the response.

members.name: fieldsToInclude
members.doc: List of tag fields to be included in the response.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: next

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.doc: List of tag fields to be included in the response.

members.name: slug
members.doc: Slug of the tag to retrieve.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of tag fields to be included in the response. By default, any `fields` not passed are not returned.

members.name: fieldsToInclude
members.doc: Array of tag fields to be included in the response. By default, any `fieldsToInclude` not passed are not returned.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Item ID. Should always be available, unless it's impossible (for example, when failing to create an item).

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `sort`.

members.name: fields
members.doc: List of tag fields to be included in the response.

members.name: fieldsToInclude
members.doc: List of tag fields to be included in the response.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sorting options. For a list of sortable fields, see [Field Support for Filtering and Sorting](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/community/blog/filter-and-sort).

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: metaData
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in this response.

members.name: cursor
members.doc: Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: fields
members.doc: List of tag fields to be included in the response.

members.name: fieldsToInclude
members.doc: List of tag fields to be included in the response.

members.name: filter
members.doc:
Filter object.
For a detailed list of supported filters, see [Field Support for Filtering and Sorting](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/community/blog/filter-and-sort).

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sorting options. For a list of sortable fields, see [Field Support for Filtering and Sorting](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/community/blog/filter-and-sort).

members.name: metaData
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: label
members.doc: Tag name. Cannot have duplicate tags on a blog.

members.name: language
members.doc: Tag language. 2-letter language code in [ISO 639-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) format.

members.name: postCount
members.doc: Number of posts with this tag, including unpublished draft posts.

members.name: publishedPostCount
members.doc: Number of published posts with this tag.

members.name: slug
members.doc: Part of a tag's URL. For example, 'https:/example.com/blog/tags/{my-tag-slug}'.

members.name: translationId
members.doc: ID of the tag translations. All translations of a single tag will share the same `translationId`.

members.name: includeUrl
members.doc: Includes tag URL when TRUE. Defaults to FALSE.
